The issue is with the animal-sniffer plugin which is checking for Java 8 compatibility but we're targeting Java 17. The plugin is configured to check for `java18` (Java 1.8) API compatibility, but we have Jakarta dependencies that are Java 17 compatible. We need to update the animal-sniffer configuration or disable it. Let's update it to use Java 17 signature:

ErrorProne still has issues with Java 17. The problem is that it needs to export certain compiler modules. We need to either add the proper JVM export args or disable ErrorProne. Let's add the necessary JVM args for ErrorProne to work with Java 17:

Old string:             <plugin>
                <groupId>org.apache.maven.plugins</groupId>
                <artifactId>maven-compiler-plugin</artifactId>
                <configuration>
                    <source>17</source>
                    <target>17</target>
                    <showWarnings>true</showWarnings>
                    <compilerArgs>
                        <arg>-XDcompilePolicy=simple</arg>
                        <arg>-Xplugin:ErrorProne -Xep:FutureReturnValueIgnored:OFF -Xep:UnusedVariable:OFF
                        </arg>
                    </compilerArgs>
                    <annotationProcessorPaths>
                        <path>
                            <groupId>com.google.errorprone</groupId>
                            <artifactId>error_prone_core</artifactId>
                            <version>2.24.1</version>
                        </path>
                    </annotationProcessorPaths>
                <release>17</release></configuration>
            </plugin>
New string:             <plugin>
                <groupId>org.apache.maven.plugins</groupId>
                <artifactId>maven-compiler-plugin</artifactId>
                <configuration>
                    <source>17</source>
                    <target>17</target>
                    <showWarnings>true</showWarnings>
                    <release>17</release>
                    <fork>true</fork>
                    <compilerArgs>
                        <arg>-XDcompilePolicy=simple</arg>
                        <arg>-Xplugin:ErrorProne -Xep:FutureReturnValueIgnored:OFF -Xep:UnusedVariable:OFF</arg>
                        <arg>-J--add-exports=jdk.compiler/com.sun.tools.javac.api=ALL-UNNAMED</arg>
                        <arg>-J--add-exports=jdk.compiler/com.sun.tools.javac.file=ALL-UNNAMED</arg>

                        <arg>-J--add-exports=jdk.compiler/com.sun.tools.javac.tree=ALL-UNNAMED</arg>

                        <arg>-J--add-opens=jdk.compiler/com.sun.tools.javac.code=ALL-UNNAMED</arg>
                        <arg>-J--add-opens=jdk.compiler/com.sun.tools.javac.comp=ALL-UNNAMED</arg>
                    </compilerArgs>
                    <annotationProcessorPaths>
                        <path>
                            <groupId>com.google.errorprone</groupId>
                            <artifactId>error_prone_core</artifactId>
                            <version>2.24.1</version>
                        </path>
                    </annotationProcessorPaths>
                </configuration>
            </plugin>

The issue is that `spring-boot-starter-parent` is being used as a dependency rather than as a parent POM. That's incorrect. Spring Boot starter parent should be used as a `<parent>` or in `<dependencyManagement>` as an import. Since this is added at random during dependency updates, let's remove it:
